alert.note: Alert for Shelby (Texas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued May 11 at 10:23AM CDT until May 11 at 10:45AM CDT by NWS Shreveport
info.description: ...FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 1115 AM CDT THIS MORNING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues. * WHERE...A portion of northeast Texas, including the following counties, Nacogdoches, Rusk and Shelby. * WHEN...Until 1115 AM CDT. * IMPACTS...Flooding of rivers, creeks, streams, and other low-lying and flood-prone locations is occurring. Numerous roads remain closed due to flooding. Low-water crossings are inundated with water and may not be passable. It will take several hours for all the water from these storms to work through local drainage systems in urban areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 1022 AM CDT, Doppler radar indicated slow moving thunderstorms with very heavy rainfall across the warned area. Between 4 and 8 inches of rain have fallen. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Nacogdoches, Tenaha, Timpson, Garrison, Trawick, Appleby, Mount Enterprise, Lawsonville, Stockman and Arcadia.
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
